page.title: 06CHURCH-EAST CARLTON
page.content: The church was rebuilt in 1788 by Sir Geoffrey Palmer who owned the nearby Hall.It is now smaller than it used to be.There are six bells,but no local band of ringers.Electricity was installed in 1948 for the organ,lights and the clock which chimes the hours. There are box pews,people sitting in their own pew every time.Instead of Memorials on the walls,people have given gifts.Recent gifts have been a cross,prayer books, vestments and a wafer box. East Carlton had its own Rector until 1964.It now shares one with Cottingham cum Middleton. The most popular service is Family Communion,the least popular being Evensong.About twelve to fourteen people attend Communion.
